tutorial.speak:
Welcome to the Website Appearance tutorial. This guide will show you how to customize your site's global appearance including colors, fonts, logos, and footer. From the B1 dashboard, click Website in the left sidebar.
This opens the Website Pages view where you manage all your pages.
Click the Appearance tab at the top to access the global appearance settings.
The Site Styles page loads, showing a preview of your website with your current colors, fonts, and logos. This preview updates as you make changes.
On the right side you'll see Style Settings options. Click Color Palette to customize your site's colors.
The Color Palette dialog opens. You'll see Base Colors at the top for light, accent, and dark shades, and Semantic Colors below for Primary, Secondary, Success, Warning, and Error. Click on any color box to change it.
A color picker appears. Drag the selector to choose your desired color, or use the color slider below. Your choice updates the preview instantly.
You can customize each semantic color. Notice how the Color Combinations Preview on the right shows how your selected colors will look together in different pairings. Below the color values, you'll find Suggested Palettes. Click any palette to instantly apply a pre-designed color scheme to your entire site. Be sure to save.
Next, let's customize fonts.
In the Typography Settings panel, you'll see options for Font Selection and a preview showing how headings will look.
Click Select a Font to open the font browser. You can search for specific fonts or browse by category.
The font list shows categories like Serif, Sans Serif, Display, Handwriting, and Monospace. Each font displays a preview of the alphabet.
Be sure to save.

The Typography Scale displays your heading hierarchy. You can see Heading 1 at 39 pixels, Heading 2 at 31 pixels, Heading 3 at 25 pixels, and Heading 4 at 20 pixels.
Click on Typography Scale to adjust the sizes. You'll see input fields where you can customize the scale multiplier and base size for all headings.
The preview updates to show how your heading sizes appear with sample text below each. You can type directly into the input fields to fine-tune your typography scale. Be sure to click save.
Click on Spacing Scale in the Style Settings menu.
The Spacing Scale dialog shows spacing values for Extra Small, Small, Medium, Large, and Extra Large, measured in pixels. Scroll down to see Practical Examples showing how your spacing values affect real UI elements like Icon Rows and Cards with Content. These examples help you visualize the spacing in context.
When you're satisfied with your spacing values, click Save Spacing to apply them across your entire site.
For advanced users, click CSS and Javascript in the Style Settings.
This opens a dialog where you can add Custom CSS to override default styles or create new styling rules. Scroll down to see the Custom HTML section and Common Javascript Examples. You can add third-party scripts like Google Analytics here. The Custom HTML field is where you paste your tracking codes or other scripts.
Click Logo in the Style Settings to open Logo and Branding.

You'll see sections for Main Logos with Light Background Logo and Dark Background Logo, as well as SEO and Browser Assets below. Upload your logos by clicking Edit Light Background Logo or Edit Dark Background Logo. Below, you can add a Social Media Image and Favicon. The favicon is the small icon that appears in browser tabs. Be sure to load images that are the correct size. Your uploaded logo now appears in the site preview at the top, showing how it will look on your actual website.
Now let's customize the footer. Click Site Footer in the Style Settings.
The Site Footer editor opens, showing an empty canvas that says No sections yet. Click the plus button in the toolbar to add content.
Click on section
Drag the section onto the footer page
Edit the section with a custom color or image or leave as is
Be sure to click save
Now click the plus sign to add other elements
A common footer set up is three rows of text, so let's select rows and add them to the page.
Drag and drop the rows element to the page and select thirds for the configeration.
Be sure to save
Now lets drop some text in each section
Drag and drop a text element to add text
The Edit Element dialog opens with a text editor. Type your church information such as name, address, and location. You can use the formatting toolbar to style your text with bold, italic, lists, and alignment options.
Click Done to save your footer. Your completed footer now shows across the page with your church name First Ironwood Church, address 1234 Ironwood Road Anytown USA, your mission statement Making Disciples Who Make Disciples, phone number, and email address. This footer will appear on every page of your website.
